intro: Centaurea turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkestan cornflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It features striking blue to purple ray florets surrounded by a series of yellow to brown tubular flowers, forming a composite flower head. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Centaurea turkestanica is often found in steppe and semi-desert environments, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions.
